name: Ginger Sesame Soy Dressing
description: Xanthan gum s sold at many grocery stores and health food markets. Look for it in bulk sections if you donâ€™t want to keep a bunch on hand. It keeps well for a long time. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.
recipeIngredient: 1/4 teaspoon xanthan gum ((optional, to avoid separation))
2 teaspoons A-1 Steak sauce, (worcestershire sauce, or Taiwanese black vinegar)
3/4 cup neutral oil, (such as canola or grapeseed)

recipeInstructions.text: Using a mortar and pestle, pound the sesame seeds to crush them. Scrape into a bowl, then add the xanthan gum, if using.
recipeInstructions.name: Using a mortar and pestle, pound the sesame seeds to crush them. Scrape into a bowl, then add the xanthan gum, if using.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk in the vinegar to combine well. Then add the remaining ingredients and whisk to combine. If the ingredients separate, whisk in 1 or 2 pinches of xanthan gum. Use immediately or refrigerate up to 1 month. If needed, re-stir or whisk before using.
